subject: Parenting
title: Conservation and Logic
description: A short lesson to help you apply Conservation and Logic.

hook.text: Pour juice from a short glass into a tall one. A four-year-old insists the tall glass has more.

buildup.text: Piaget called this 'conservation' â€” knowing quantity stays the same despite appearance.

discovery.text: Children grasp conservation between five and seven as logical thinking matures.

twist.text: Before this, looks always win. Two cookies broken into four pieces seems like more cookies.

climax.text: Mastering conservation signals the brain has shifted from perceptual to logical reasoning.

punchline.text: Looks can deceive. Logic knows better.

quiz.question: What is Piaget's concept of 'conservation'?
options: Understanding quantity stays the same despite changes in appearance
